intro: Trithuria inconspicua subsp. inconspicua, commonly known as the slender water-cress, is a small aquatic plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. The plant has narrow, ribbon-like leaves that are often submerged, with small white flowers that appear in clusters. It is characterized by its delicate appearance and preference for nutrient-rich waters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
